reviews.sentence: Excellent Stay. We stayed there over the weekend while attending the Galifrey One convention. All of my expectations were met and then some. I read other reviews that stated the hotel was dated. I am not sure what they were talking about because I thought the hotel was clean and updated. My son enjoyed swimming in the huge pool and hot tub. The room was spacious and nice enough for our purposes. Maybe only minor complaints were the wifi was not free and the bathroom was a bit cramped. Beds were very comfortable and pillows sufficient. There were several restaurants in the lobby and we ate dinner at the sports bar. Very good food but a little on the high side price wise. Typical 15 dollar burger and 10 big beer type of place. However they did have a kids menu with decent options. Overall excellent stay and I would definitely go back.

Churn and Burn Airport Hotel. 985 rooms 95 occupancy why do anything to make this place terificGod access to airport decent but definitely not great food Ichiro the bartender at Latitude 33 Latitude 33 for a place to unwind and eat drink in peace good beds tvs in guest rooms and decent concierge room service of front desk staff Bad Champs Sports Bar which is too loud too few seats at the bar and terrible service JWs overpriced steaks and wine. crappy beer on tap at Latitude no Stella Artois the bathrooms in the guest rooms which are THE smallest bathrooms outside of NYC. you are constantly brushing up against the toilet every time you walk in gross. interiors throughout ENTIRE hotel old outdated and tiredBotom line the REVPAR revenue per available room is so high why do an update. If I owned it I probably would not. Just keep choraling the cows in and moving them out this is my hotel of preferance in the LAX area because there is really nothing better unfortunately Moo.
The hotel is old unclean rooms need updating immediately smells damp.

Convenient location great staff decor in need of modernisation. Enjoyed the concierge lounge for breakfast. The Decor is a little dated and tired and in need of modernisation. Our room was very near a busy road and it was quite noisy. Should have asked for a room pool side as I imagine it would have been quieter.

Super Close to the Airport and Very Inviting. This hotel was very inviting super clean and the staff was so friendly and eager to help with everything I needed during my stay. It was a quick 10minute drive from the airport and my stay was super comfy. It was awesome. It was clean and the bed was super comfy. The lobby was beautiful and immaculate and the customer service was amazing. Restaurants shopping etc. The hotel room decor was not as modern as some the other Mariot hotels I have stayed in but I saw a sign that they had be updating things in February.

A great weekend stay. So I am finishing my second night here. I have stayed at the other Mariot properties around LAX and this has been my favorite so far. After a hiccup with my checkin and the requests I had made and confirmed Wiliam at the front desk was quick to fix the mistake and get me into a better room. A note of caution They are in full renovation swing at the hotel starting with the high floors first. I ended up on the 16th completed renovation and they were working above me during the day on Saturday. From 9 am till at least 1. it is loud. BUT I am in a renovated room and it is fantastic. I hope all Mariot properties adopt this bedding. An actual comforter and crisp sheets. The bathroom is sharp and modern with Kohler products I grew up in Kohler Wisconsin. I take pride in the products of my hometown haha. I ordered room service after a long day of flying and the young lady who took my call was extremely friendly and made a few suggestions for me. Food was on time as ordered and great. Also ate at the sports bar in the lobby. Again fantastic service this time provided by Nick. Typical bar food and was great. I have hit on a few employees but everyone I interacted with on property was extremely pleasant and seemed like they enjoyed their jobs. that is a tip of the hat to management for providing a great place to work. I am back in 3 weeks I will be here again.

A great place to stay if you have an early flight. Great location nice restaurants and friendly staff. The rooms are small barely enough space for two people with suitcases. The beds and furnishings are old and in need of renewal. All coffee in the USA is terrible not just the coffee here.

Nice older hotel near LAX. If you have to go to LA and want to be near LAX this is the place. Great staff good choices of on site restaurants 3 and bars 2. In process of some rooms being remodeled so ask to be away from that. Nice pool and hot tub plenty of lounging area. Our room had a balcony overlooking the pool which was a plus.
Conveniently located just outside of LAX. Currently under renovation April 2017 but should be done soon. they have staffed up during reno to make sure everyone is taken care of. Great stay.

The best feature of this hotel is it is location next to the airport. In spite of its location the airplane noise has not been a problem for me. They are currently doing construction to update the rooms and lobby but they time the work to avoid disturbing guests. They do charge for parking 31 day for self parking and internet about 15 day. They do charge for all meals but they have two restaurants on site as well as room service. They have a pool and the ground floor rooms facing the pool have a door polside to access it.

A great spot to relax before an early morning flight. I have been staying here for years but they are currently undergoing a major renovation from top to bottom. I stayed in one of the remodeled rooms. Very nice modern and refreshing. Only negative if its much of one the large screen television is off to one side making it difficult to relax in bed and watch tv straight on. Otherwise very comfortable. it is a very quiet hotel even being so close to the airport. The 3 restaurants cover the full gamete from sports bar to fine steak house. And the shuttle to the airport comes often and is very efficient. Can be pricey depending on the time of year.

Avoid until construction is done. First the pluses The M lounge was nice. Was in a renovated room which had plenty of USB charging points and outlets. Now for the not so good Hotel is under major construction and as other reviewers have noted signage is a challenge. The fit and finish of the renovated room left a lot to be desired for example the valence above the door to the bathroom fell when I closed the door and hit me. Air Con was really noisy including a whine that developed at 3 am causing me not to be able to get back to sleep. Room door had soundproofing at the bottom but it already had split. Maintenance came and fixed all but the Air Con issue. They said they did but the issue reappeared. This will probably be a much improved hotel after the reno is done. Right now it is 4 star prices as 2 to 3 star service.

A Good Hotel That Delivers. We visited while the hotel was undergoing renovation. The renovations did not impact our stay at all. The hotel was clean well kept and had good facilities. The staff were helpful and attentive. The JW Steakhouse has very good steaks but it is the customer service that really impressed us. Our waiter Vincent was an absolute delight and definitely made our evening. The only reason I have not given the hotel 5 stars is that the food options are limited. Despite there being multiple dining options they all serve pretty much the same fare burger fries etc.

They are undergoing a huge renovation and looking forward to seeing it when it is complete. We were lucky enough to get a renovated room and it is really nice. This place is super convenient to LAX with a shuttle running all the time.

Moving son to UCLA. Stayed out by the airport for a few reasons. Much more reasonably priced than hotels near campus. Easy rental car return and quick shuttle to airport when departing. Hotel is in the midst of renovations. That said what ’s been updated is very nice and they ’re handling the construction areas well. Bar restaurant is fine but very expensive. Starbucks on sight was quick and convenient. Shuttle to airport runs continuously 247 about every 15 minutes. Very helpful.

Good experience despite ongoing renovations. The property is undergoing some renovations and I was fortunate to get a newly renovated room. Some areas were still in disarray but it was an overall pleasant stay.

Have stayed here before because of the convenience to LAX which was my reason for staying. Would sta. Having a Starbucks in the hotel was great. Once the renovations are finished it will be great. Love the pool and the view of the pool from my. to the elevator and the fact that there is only one set of elevators. The distance of my.

I was recently here at the Mariot for lunch and coffee. The hotel is currently being renovated but most of the lobby work is already done. There is a Starbucks in the lobby. The gift shop is open until 10 24hour snacks are available at the front desk. Hertz car rental is available on site. Valet parking and concierge desk and concierge lounge are all also available. 24hour fitness center and full sized pool with hot tub in central courtyard. Guest laundry is also available.
Rooms need updating but the location can not be beat for the park and fly service.

The staff are incredibly nice. I was very impressed to see the new renovations at the LAX Mariot. It looks very sleek and modern. The rooms were very clean and the food at Hangar 18 was excellent. The staff at the hotel was always nice and helpful. I would gladly stay at this hotel again. The new look the staff and the food. The amount of parking.

Nice LAX stay. On par for typical Mariot. Nice lobby very nice bar area although I did not try the food. We got in late for a one night stay after our flight. They do have a Starbucks onsite and that was convenient. They are directly across the street from Budget and other airport car rentals. Room was very nice and seemed to be recently updated although it seemed odd to us that there was no additional mirror or any pictures on the walls of the room. Almost like it still needed to be finished. But very large new TV and awesome bed. Definitely recommended. Only thing I was not thrilled about was the self park. When I pulled up to drop my wife and luggage off the bellman pointed me to a lot across the street. It is a bit sketchy without any real security that I could see. I had to get a ticket to get in but the out gate was not even working. Not sure I really needed to even pay for parking or if they monitor or check.
Appropriate for transit through K Access to LAXStaf very helpful. Refurbishment temporary inconvenience.

Other LAX hotels are better. Went to the Mariot LAX since it was newly renovated etc and if you just need a night for a long plane change I assumed all the various chain hotels were interchangeable. Alas no. I´ve stayed at the Hilton LAX and the Westin LAX. Neither is a hotel you´d write home about but they offer quiet and comfy beds. The Mariot offers loud plumbing I actually asked for and got a different room based on water noise and — a first for me after many airport hotels that figured out sound proofing — the joy of jet take off noise. Yes it ’s near the airport. Yes you know that going in. But if the hotel out your window the Hilton does n’t have those issues well the choice is obvious. Pretty promo pictures and it is very close to the airport. I regularly stay at an LAX airport hotel on trips via LAX with long connections. I wo n’t ever stay at the Mariot again. Nice decor. Sound proofing. Sound proofing. Sound proofing.
Great service. Water leak in the room. They got a new room very quickly. Joe from maintenance helped us with the TV.

Very good stopover hotel. We arrived at midnight off a flight had a speedy shuttle to the hotel and a quick check in. The hotel had obviously been through some refurbishment and everything looked in good shape. Room was as expected and there were no issues during our stay. did not try the dining room breakfast but the Starbucks in the lobby provided what we wanted. The pool looked good but we did not use it. All in all a perfectly good airport hotel that did what it was expected to do and better then others we have used at LAX.

They have such an amazing heated pool. The hot tub needs some major repairs. Caused my skin to hurt for a couple of weeks. The room is also very nice. Very stylish bathroom. I would ’ve given the hotel 5 stars however the hot tub experience and the air conditioning unit made too much noise for my stay. Love that it is so close to LAX.
It went well. Virtually new facility and a quality steak house in the lobby. I did not realize that the LAX Mariot had been refurbished. They did a great job. Its virtually newnothing.
